statements.name: PROC PATHING
statements.description: The PROC PATHING statement performs pathing analysis.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the input transactional table.

arguments.name: ADJACENT
arguments.description: specifies that any adjacent items in a sequence must be adjacent in their transactions.

arguments.name: ENCODEITEM
arguments.description: replaces item substring separators ('-->', '==>', and '&') with XML-style encoding.

arguments.name: FILTERINNEROPS=
arguments.description: specifies a list of AND or OR logic operators. Each element controls the logical operation among the filter elements in an inner list of filters.

arguments.name: FILTEROUTEROPS=
arguments.description: specifies whether the outer operator is AND or OR.

arguments.name: FILTERS=
arguments.description: specifies a list of regular expression strings as constraints that sequences must follow.

arguments.name: HASHFUNCTION=
arguments.description: specifies the 32-bit hash function to be used to generate the hash value for a sequence string.
arguments.help: HASHFUNCTION=BERNSTEIN | CAS | DBJ2 | ELF | FNV1A | JENKIN | MURMUR3 | PJW | SDBM | SUPERFAST

arguments.name: NOMERGE
arguments.description: specifies that each transaction constructs a sequence for each sub-sequence within it.

arguments.name: OMITDUPLICATE
arguments.description: omits duplicate items within a sequence.

arguments.name: OMITLEADINGBLANKS
arguments.description: omits the leading blanks of each item value in the sequence string. This option does not alter the values of the individual item columns in the output tables.

arguments.name: OMITTRAILINGBLANKS
arguments.description: omits the trailing blanks of each item value in the sequence string. This option does not alter the values of the individual item columns in the output tables.

arguments.name: SAVEHASH
arguments.description: saves in the result table or CAS output table a hash value for the final sequence string according to the value of the hash function.

arguments.name: SAVESEQUTRANSMAP
arguments.description: saves an additional sequence ID column in the results summary table or the output table.

arguments.name: SAVETRANSACTIONS
arguments.description: saves the list of hosting transactions where each sequence appears.

arguments.name: SUPPORTRANGE=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum and maximum support values as integers for a sequential rule. Rules whose support is outside this range are rejected.

arguments.name: TRANSACTIONSEPARATOR
arguments.description: specifies the separator string for transactions per sequence.

statements.name: CUSTOMER
statements.description: The CUSTOMER statement specifies the sequence or customer column of the input table.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the sequence or customer column of the input table.

arguments.name: AGGREGATE=
arguments.description: specifies the aggregation function to be applied to a sequence at each occurrence in the data set to create a final score for the sequence.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies the format of the CUSTOMER variable.

arguments.name: OMITMISSING
arguments.description: omits the observations that have missing values for the CUSTOMER variable.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: The FREQ statement specifies the frequency variable to be used to compute the score of each sequence by using the WEIGHT statement. If you omit this option, the score of a sequence equals the weight scaled by 1.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the frequency variable to be used to compute the score of each sequence by using the WEIGHT option. If you omit this option, the score of a sequence equals the weight scaled by 1.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement specifies the in-memory table to store the pathing information, such as the support, chain length, absolute length, and count, for every sequence in the data set.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies the in-memory table to store the pathing information, such as the support, chain length, absolute length, and count, for every sequence in the data set.

arguments.name: SEQUTRANSMAPOUT=
arguments.description: creates a second table to save the map between every sequence index and the associated transactions.

statements.name: SCORE
statements.description: The SCORE statement specifies the minimum and maximum scores for a sequence. If you do not specify a WEIGHT variable, this statement is ignored.

arguments.name: RANGE=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum and maximum scores for a sequence.

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: The TARGET statement specifies the target column of the input table.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the target column of the input table.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies the format of the TARGET or ITEM variable.

arguments.name: AGGREGATE=
arguments.description: specifies the aggregation function to be applied to the WEIGHT variables to create a score for the sequence.

arguments.name: RANGE=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum and maximum number of nonconcurrent items that a sequence can contain.

arguments.name: NOSAVE
arguments.description: specifies that items and separators not be saved.

arguments.name: OMITMISSING
arguments.description: omits the observations that have missing values for the TARGET or ITEM variable.

statements.name: VISIT
statements.description: The VISIT statement specifies the event or time column of the input table.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the event or time column of the input table.

arguments.name: AGGREGATE=
arguments.description: specifies the aggregation function that, when paired with the window option, updates the anchor time.

arguments.name: OMITMISSING
arguments.description: omits the observations that have missing values for the VISIT variable.

arguments.name: DURATIONRANGE=
arguments.description: specifies the range of elapsed time between the time values for the first and last items in a sequence. If the elapsed time is outside this specified range, the sequence is excluded.

arguments.name: WINDOWRANGE=
arguments.description: specifies the range of elapsed time between two adjacent items in a sequence. If the elapsed time is outside this range, the two items are not in the same sequence.

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: The WEIGHT statement specifies the numeric weight variable to be used to compute the score of each sequence by using the FREQ statement.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the numeric weight variable to be used to compute the score of each sequence by using the FREQ statement.
